text: Blade Runner 2049 is a 2017 American neo-noir science fiction movie directed by Denis Villeneuve and written by Hampton Fancher and Michael Green. A sequel to Blade Runner (1982), the movie stars Ryan Gosling and Harrison Ford, with Ana de Armas, Sylvia Hoeks, Robin Wright, Mackenzie Davis, Carla Juri, Lennie James, Dave Bautista and Jared Leto in supporting roles. ==Plot== Set thirty years after the original film, the story depicts a replicant blade runner named K, who discovers the remains of a once-pregnant replicant. To prevent a possible war between species, K is secretly tasked with finding the child and destroying all evidence related to it, leading him to discover that the child bears a connection to missing blade runner Deckard. ==Release== Blade Runner 2049 premiered in Los Angeles on October 3, 2017 and was released in the United States on October 6, 2017, in 2D, 3D and IMAX. The movie received acclaim from critics, with some regarding it as one of the best sequels ever made. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:2017 science fiction movies Category:Warner Bros. movies Category:American science fiction movies Category:Movies about genetic engineering Category:Robot movies Category:Movies based on books Category:Movies directed by Denis Villeneuve Category:Dystopian movies Category:Movies composed by Hans Zimmer Category:Movies composed by Benjamin Wallfisch
title: Blade Runner 2049
